statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content:
Matt has N friends. They are playing a game together.

Each of Matt’s friends has a magic number. In the game, Matt selects some (could be zero) of his friends. If the xor (exclusive-or) sum of the selected friends’magic numbers is no less than M , Matt wins.

Matt wants to know the number of ways to win.

statement.title: Input
statement.content:
The first line contains only one integer T , which indicates the number of test cases.

For each test case, the first line contains two integers N, M (1 ≤ N ≤ 40, 0 ≤ M ≤ 106).

In the second line, there are N integers ki (0 ≤ ki ≤ 106), indicating the i-th friend’s magic number.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each test case, output a single line “Case #x: y”, where x is the case number (starting from 1) and y indicates the number of ways where Matt can win.

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
Case #1: 4
Case #2: 2


Hint
In the ﬁrst sample, Matt can win by selecting:
friend with number 1 and friend with number 2. The xor sum is 3.
friend with number 1 and friend with number 3. The xor sum is 2.
friend with number 2. The xor sum is 2.
friend with number 3. The xor sum is 3. Hence, the answer is 4.
